page.title: 16Wick Choral Society
page.content: Wick has had a Choral Society for several years. A Choral Society differs from a choir in that it performs choral works as opposed to part-songs. Choral Works are works composed exclusively for Choral Societies, whereas, part-songs are usually arrangements of unison songs, e.g. "The Red Red Robin", arranged for four different voices, i.e. Soprano, Alto, Tenor, Bass. On Saturday 11th May,1985, the Wick Choral Society performed a selection of choral works in the Parish Church, Wick. The programme consisted of "Zadok The Priest" composed by Handel, Vivaldis "Gloria", and Schuberts Mass in G. The soloists for this performance were Carol-Anne Petherick - Soprano, Janice Bruce - Alto, Stuart Rathie - Tenor and Charles Sinclair - Bass. The musical director was Kyle Campbell.
